dialogue: Well, if you're not holding a meeting or anything.
You want to come inside?
Well, I'd love to see inside your club.
Is there something else I can do for you?
That poor boy's a crack dealer from Alphabet City.  We do not allow his kind on this block.
What about yesterday?  Kicking that poor boy?
You don't have to worry.  She's going to be fine.  We're law-abiding citizens just like you.
I'm just concerned about my daughter.
Who told you we deal drugs?
And you don't deal drugs?
We like to think so, yeah.
My daughter lives across the street from you people and she tells me that you keep this area safe.  Is that true?
Yeah, sure, no problem, you're welcome.
Excuse me, sir.  I just wanted to thank you for helping me get into my building yesterday.
Have a nice day.
What happened?  Did you lose your keys?
Oh, let me get out of your way then.
I just need to use the phone, lady.
Oh, please, don't hurt me.
Goodbye, sweetheart.
Well, bye.  And have a safe trip ... and ... Paris in the spring!
Mm hmm.
I love you, Mom.  I have to run.  You remembered to call the limousine service, right?
I can make my own decisions.
Mother!
At my age, I'm going to take any pill that makes me feel better.
Here you go.  I think you should talk to Dr. Byrne when you get back about how much Valium he's prescribing.  Okay?
I'd love to.
Dear, I was thinking.  Why don't we go to Paris next year?  I've never been.  Your father, God bless him, wasn't much for traveling.
You wouldn't be in the way.  I like having you around.
Oh, I don't want to be in the way. You've got your career and everything.
I think you should consider coming out and staying with me longer.
Mm hmm.
It's unusually quiet tonight, isn't it?
I'm sorry.
Yeah ... turned out to be a real jerk.
Aaron?
You know that guy in the pictures you saw?
Oh, I hope so, dear.
No, I had a dream about daddy.  Do you think I'll ever meet anyone like him?
If it's about the bikers, dear, I don't want to talk about it.
Mom, I need to talk to you.
No, no, it's my fault.  I've been pushing you too hard to do things on your own.
Oh, that has nothing to do with it.
Mom ... I mean, it's amusing to imagine such a thing, but ... how many of those pills have you been taking?
What's wrong?
My daughter lives right across the street from the Satan's Disciples' clubhouse, and I was so worried about her ... so, I went over and introduced myself. And they were the nicest people.
Mother, I ...
Oh, it's so nice to meet you.
Don, this is my mother.  Mom, this is my boss, Don Palmer.
That's not true.  Besides, I don't want you dusting.  I want you to see New York.
You know, you never tell me anything.
I don't want to talk about it.
He seemed quite taken with you.
I was seeing Aaron and there were some ... complications.
But I was dusting.
Behind the books.
Well, they were right out in plain view.
Mother!
You know ...  ... whoops!
What pictures?
What about the fellow in those pictures?
No, I'm working too much, I don't have time.
Dating anyone?
I'm good.
How are you doing sweetheart?
That's why it's good you came to visit me.
I just can't seem to focus on anything these days.
I've never had any problem with them. People say it's the safest block in the East Village.  I just hope their motorcycles don't keep you up at night.
The motorcycle gang?  Don't they deal drugs and rape young girls?
That's the Satan's Disciples' New York headquarters.
... What are they all doing there?
Uh-huh?
I wanted to ask you something.  Those motorcycles across the street ...?
That's New York.  It looks rundown, but it's safe during the day.  You'll get used to it.
Well, when I walked up the block, I ... well, my word!
You don't like where I live?
Well, once you're inside, it's nice.
So, what do you think?
... Manly?
I wonder what they do in there?  Don't they frighten you?  They all look so ...
Oh.  Well, that would be a ... change.  Thank you, Mrs. Peterson.  You have a very reassuring voice.
He's an organic farmer.
What does he do?
You know, you ought to come out to South Dakota some time and meet my son, Steve. He's single.
Poor man had to leave town.  And I hear that other women came forward.
What happened?
Oh, it was such a big scandal.
Really?
Men ... they're all the same.  Our pastor in Sioux Falls was caught with his wife's sister.

And there was this number on my phone bill that I didn't recognize.  Calls made at three and four in the morning.  So, I called the number ... and a woman answered.  And I ... I hung up.  So, then I followed him.  Just like in the movies.  And I found out that he has a wife and a little girl living in Brooklyn.  We had been going together for almost a year.
Oh.  You need a cappuccino.
I'm sorry.  I had a wretched night.
Oh.  I thought today was Saturday.
She's at work.  I'm her mother.
It's Marika.  Is Paula there?
Who is it?
Thirty is base price.  Tolls, tax, tip ... it all adds up.
Forty-five?  I thought it was only supposed to be thirty?
Forty-five all total.
I see.  How much?
Yeah.  Not far.  You will be fine.  It's still day.
This way?
This is one-way street.  You go down the block to the middle.
Nah, not dangerous.  Not that dangerous.  Not during the day.
You mean it's dangerous?
Oh, yeah ... yeah ... it's a hellhole.
Ohhh.  Do you know the East Village?
Moscow.
I'm from South Dakota.  Where are you from?
Yeah.
... And the children thought I should take a trip.
Uh, yes.  My husband passed away recently ...
So, you come here all by yourself?
She would have come to the airport to meet me - she wanted to - but ... but, she just started a new job and, well, I guess no one drives here.
And where is she?
I came to New York to visit my youngest daughter.
I'm sorry, I'm a little nervous.  It's my first time in New York.  Just a minute.
What do you think?  I left it on the curb?
Are you sure you got my bag in?
Where to?
No!!  I can prove it to you.  I'll take you to her.
We all know what happened.  In a fit of jealous rage you killed Simone and dumped her body off a boat she bought for you.
I am telling the truth.
Why don't you just come clean, Viktor?  Tell the truth.  You'll feel better afterwards.
It wasn't her body.  It was her body of work.
Can you tell us why you were disposing of the body of a woman who didn't exist?
Who?
But not everyone's imaginary, are they, Mr. Taransky?  I refer, of course, to Edith.
And this Mr. Hank Aleno who you talk so much about, a renowned failure, who also happens to be so conveniently dead -- perhaps the "man" you claim helped invent Simone is an invention himself?
Of course.
So, of course, you couldn't kill Simone because there never was a Simone.
Oh, no.  The fan club is real.  But they were worshipping computer code -- ones and zeros.
A fan club with a worldwide membership in the millions -- also bogus?
That's right.  You understand perfectly.  I will confess to fraud, not murder.

-- Forgive me, Mr. Taransky.  I'm just trying to understand.  All these films, TV appearances, magazine covers, internet interviews, publicity photos, snapshots from her childhood -- all fake.  This is fake, this is fake -- fake, fake, fake, all fake.
Good-bye.
I'm glad we talked.
Thanks.  This is my exit so, I --
Okay -- for you.
Christ --  Elaine, I know how it looks but...  ... it would mean a lot to Viktor if you'd go with him to the Oscars. If you won't do it for him, please do it for me.
Simone, I recognize the shirt you're wearing.  I gave it to Viktor on his birthday.
I don't know how many times I have to say this, Elaine, but Viktor and I are not in love.  I only make love to the camera.
We have a daughter together.  I just don't want to see Viktor get hurt.
It sounds like you still have feelings for him.
Exactly.  You're a household name now.  You're moving in entirely different worlds.  That's why I hope you're not toying with Viktor.
Damn --  Yes -- I --  -- I'm just a little tired. Listen, Elaine, Viktor and I -- it's strictly a working relationship.  We could never be anything else.  We're just so... different.
My God, are you alright, Simone?
I'm not --  He's not.
You don't have to protect my feelings, Simone.  I don't blame Viktor for falling in love with the most desirable woman in the world.
I want to reassure you, Elaine, there's absolutely nothing going on between Viktor and I.
I think he owes more to you.  But that's not important now.  I know what's going on between you two.
I can't imagine how you ever let a man like that go.  I owe Viktor everything.
No, I understand.  That's what I want to talk about.  I don't know if you know this, Simone, but Viktor and I were married once.
I'd love to stop somewhere but I'm late.  I'm on my way to see Viktor now.
No... it's life.
Don't look so glum, Viktor.  It's not a death sentence.
That sounds wonderful.  How do you feel about all this, Lainey?
I was thinking -- what about you and... "Simone" moving back in with me and Lainey?
Exactly.  Now that you have the studio behind you, we can really do things.
Why stop at one character when you can have a whole cast?
Don't thank us too fast, Viktor. You know what we have to do?
Thank you!  I don't know how you did it but thank you.
How can you bring that up at a time like this?
Can I see you later -- go away for the weekend?

No!  Whatever talent Simone has comes from me -- me!  Me!  I swear, as God is my judge.  You don't know what I've been through.  Tens of thousands of mind-numbing hours in front of that screen, nights without end, and look what it's cost me.  Why do you think I've been wearing these?  I may have done irreparable harm to my eyesight, and why?  To extract and refine the infinite nuances of a human being -- a human soul.  Don't you see?  I made Simone!
You're drunker than I thought.  Are you doing that again?

-- She's a figment of my own imagination.  I, Viktor Taransky, have perpetrated the greatest hoax, the greatest sleight-of-hand, sleight-of-mouth, sleight-of- sleight in entertainment history! And still no one appreciates me, recognizes what I've done -- even you.
How much wine have you had?
Who says that -- ?  -- Never mind.  You have to listen to me, Elaine.  Simone is thin air, pixels, molded by me from a mathematical equation.  I inherited it from a madman -- I can show you --
-- You just got lucky that she's loyal enough to stay with you. Maybe she's staying out of pity, who knows?  She certainly doesn't need you.  Some people even say you're holding her back.
-- No, no, I didn't trip over her. You don't understand --

Every actor is an invention, Viktor.  Don't embarrass yourself. No one's denying that you discovered Simone.  But it's like finding a diamond in the desert. Anyone can trip over it, but it's not the finder who sparkles.
I'm going to tell you a secret now, Elaine.  Simone is not a real person.  I invented her.
You?
Not if I don't let her.
Of course she will.  Her public will demand it.
No.  She'll never work again -- retire, never make a movie or a record, or appear ever again.
But you don't understand.  She'll always be there -- at some party, on some magazine cover, some song on the radio, up on some screen.
No, I will end my relationship with her -- totally.
Oh, Viktor.  You say that now -- because we're here, alone, like this.  But in the morning, you'd go back to her.  What man wouldn't?
No, there isn't.  There's nothing to her.

That's sweet, Viktor, but I couldn't let you do that -- make that kind of sacrifice.  It's strange.  I've stabbed people in the back, clawed and slept my way to where I am -- it goes with the territory -- but, for some reason, I can't betray Simone. There's... I don't know any other way to say it -- there's a goodness to her.
I would rather have you than Simone.  Believe me.
This is crazy.  Who am I fooling? I can't compete with Simone.  What woman can?
I want you back too, Viktor.
-- She already is.  Simone's not coming over, Elaine.  Not tonight, not ever.  I want you back, Elaine.
-- And she was positively glowing at the awards.  I should be going, she'll be here soon --
I know.  I know.  They'll say anything.
I just read somewhere --
Impossible.
I'm sure you'll keep her focussed. She's lucky to have you, Viktor.  Is she really having your baby?
Not quite.
Is Simone back to earth yet?
I suppose I could stay, just until she arrives.
About now.  Would you like a drink?
When is she coming over?
As a matter-of-fact I am.
Is it Wednesday?  It's Wednesday. How embarrassing.  I don't know what I was thinking.  With all the excitement lately...  Am I interrupting something?  Are you expecting company?
Elaine, it's Wednesday.
I can imagine.
She's lying down.  She's exhausted.
... Simone.
Lainey and I just wanted to congratulate...
My two favorite girls.
It's a crowded summer.  We need every photo-opp, sound-byte and column inch we can get.  Good night, Viktor.
Excuse me?  Start?
Yes, you do...  Anyway, tonight was a good start.
I do?
Whenever I compliment Simone, you take the credit.
Do what?
Viktor, do you realize you always do that?
Thank you.

Well, yes.  From a studio point of view, it would be better if Simone stayed single.  Anyhow, I thought she came across great tonight.  Intelligent, well informed, a natural.  And touching. She was spectacular.
No, of course not!  Why?  Would you care if we were?
Are you and Simone...  ... getting married?
No.
-- Viktor, are you with her?  Is she there?
Oh, yes.  Of course.  Don't I always?
I'd love to.  But aren't you supposed to meet up with Simone?
Elaine, what are you doing tonight? Would you like to go somewhere -- dinner?
Really?
She said you were very beautiful.
She was there.  She didn't by any chance happen to mention me?
I'll try.  Maybe live but remote. She'll never go to them.
Oh, make it live -- please, Viktor.
I'll tell you what.  I know how much this means to you.  I'll try to get her to plug the film.  I'm not promising anything but maybe she'll do a talk show -- taped.
You're so good to protect her like this.
She doesn't want pity.
Viktor, you should have said something.
The premiere was the first time I've convinced her to venture out and it just confirmed her worst nightmares.
-- I don't think that's necessary. I think it's perfectly clear.  I should have guessed -- it all makes sense now... it's why she never goes anywhere, never seen in public...
-- I can explain.
So, the secret's finally out, Viktor.
Not now.  She's emotional.  Her mother dies today.  Scene forty-two of "Good For Nothing".  It's not a good time.
-- It's starting to look like she doesn't support the film or you, Viktor.  If you can't handle her, I will.
-- We have to talk to her, Viktor!
-- You can't go in there!
That's true.
Everyone you know is lying.
Everyone I know has met her, Viktor.
Soon.  Soon.
I'd love to tell her myself.  When are you going to let me meet her?
Thank you.  I'll tell Simone you liked it.

Yes.  To be honest I never quite saw this film before -- maybe it's the way Simone is playing it -- but what it's saying about the illusion of permanence in everyday life, how that's the only way we can love -- I think it's really going to mean something.
You really think so?
I should fire you more often.  The film's looking wonderful.
Better late than never.
Maybe you're right.  Twelve years after your daughter's born you decide to become a father.
Who else?  It's always Simone's idea.
That's genius, Viktor.  Was that Simone's idea?
I got them to remove the reflection.  The mirror's metaphor -- to show how her character's inwardly dead.
Thank you.  What did you think, Lainey?
Stunning, Viktor.  The Hollywood Foreign Press is going to eat this up.
Viktor, I have a feeling.  One of my feelings.  There's something about her I don't trust.
Simone does not control my destiny.
Experience, Viktor.  I've seen this a hundred times -- young stars destroying the very people who discovered them.  I'm worried about you, that's all.  This woman -- she controls your destiny.
Elaine, talking to you now, not as Viktor, director, but Viktor, ex husband... what the hell happened to you?

Listen, Viktor... I want to talk to you now, not as Elaine, studio head, but Elaine, ex-wife.  Second ex-wife.  You got lucky this last time but you need to be careful.  We both know you wouldn't be making this overblown art film of you hadn't convinced Simone to be in it.
I'll walk you out.
Not today.  She's learning her lines.  You can also take cue cards and teleprompter out of the budget.
Which accounts for your percentage.  When do I get to meet this dream?

As I've tried to explain to you, Elaine.  Simone isn't like any other actress you've ever known. She's about the work and only the work -- lives for the work.  She wants all the money up there...  ... on the screen where it belongs. She'd work for scale except I know you only respect people you pay a fortune.
Well, shoot it on the last day.
Even the fall from the plane.
Even the fall from the plane?
No need.  She does all her own stunts.
There isn't one.
What about it?
Well, we have to do something about this -- "stuntwoman".
-- I guarantee she won't gain an once.  She's very disciplined.
Al least a contingency for wardrobe.  Any woman can go up a dress size.
I'll send you her resume.
She was in the theater?  When? Where?
She'll do her own.  Theater training.
Hair and make-up?
She'll drive herself.
Well, something has to be done about this budget.  It's completely unrealistic.  You allowed nothing for limousine service.
If it's on the page...
Really?  Oh, so she's really going to do all this nudity?
There aren't any.  If the filmmakers are happy, Simone's happy.  She considers herself an... "instrument".
Whatever.  I still haven't received Simone's script notes.
Forever.
Viktor, we simply have to talk about "Eternity..."
Why not?
No problem.  Do you want to come in?
Sorry I didn't get her back in time.
She's my actor.  There are other studios, Elaine.  There's only one Simone.  Leave the press conference to me.
Viktor, it's my studio.
Out of the question.  A circus like that?
Don't be ridiculous.  I arranged a press conference.
As I say, she's... something of a recluse.  That's how she's able to stay so pure -- by isolating herself in her art.
Why not?
I don't know if that's going to happen.
I can't wait to meet her.
Almost right.

I don't have it on me.  Anyway, it means a lot.  Have you read the reviews?  They're love letters.  Listen to this one.  "Simone has the voice of a young Jane Fonda, the body of Sophia Loren, the grace of, well, Grace Kelley, and the face of Audrey Hepburn combined with an angel".
Don't thank me.  It was entirely Simone's decision.  Do you have Simone's check?
Viktor... I want to thank you for convincing Simone to sign with the studio.
Why?  Because she would never show up at something like this.  She's intensely private.
Why isn't she with you?
Good to see you too, Elaine.
Where is she?
Even if you find her, you know the problem with unknowns, Viktor.  If they're good, they get known.  And then you're back to sorting their candy... and worse.  I'm sorry, Viktor.
I don't need a star.  All I need is an actor -- I'll reshoot the part, cut out Nicola and replace her with a real actor.  A real leading lady.
They're yours.  But how are you going to finish it?  Without a star there's no movie.
So there's no problem -- I can have the rights, the negative too?
The picture's dead.
You can have everything -- office, car, assistants -- all I want is the picture.

I'm not taking away your daughter, just your deal.  You and I both know, after the divorce I kept you on for old time's sake, so you could still hold your head up in front of Lainey.  I called what's his name at Warner's.  He said he'd take a meeting -- in July.  I've fought for you Viktor...  You want to talk severance?
How can I?  Your last three pictures tanked.  The board is giving me hell.  No bankable star will work with you after this.  If you just compromised... a little.
You're not renewing my contract.
-- Christ, Viktor, look around. What do you think pays for all this?  This is about investment and return.  Those days in New York... that's... it's over.
Spare me.
Listen, Viktor, I have good memories of those days too -- but this isn't about that or you or me or some high-minded ideal.  This is business.
-- Illuminate hearts and minds with a ray of truth.
-- It's called a projector.

Well, I do remember why I started out in this business -- you seem to have forgotten -- working in New York with Cassevetes -- we were trying to do something important, shine a light in that darkened cinema --
You realize you're nostalgic for an era you weren't even born in?

We can hardly make a profit with them.  Up-front salary, back-end deal, perks, per diem, percentages -- They're mocking us, Elaine. We're at their mercy.  We always had movie stars but they used to be our stars.  We used to decide who would play what role. We told them what to wear, what to say, who to date.  When they were under contract, we could change their names if we wanted to -- more than once!
It's the truth.  Those 17 superstars are our insurance policy.  We can't open -- can't make a profit without them.
Please.
The public decides who's on that list.
Elaine, she doesn't have any children!  Don't you see?  We're being held hostage by 12 men and 5 women who someone somewhere has decreed are the A-list.
-- What's wrong with that?

-- I'll tell you why.  It is because Miss Nicola Anders, supermodel with a SAG card God's gift to cinema, has it written into her contract that all cherry Mike & Ike's be removed from her candy dish along with strict instructions that any room she walks into should have seven packs of cigarettes waiting for her three of them opened, that there be a personal jacuzzi within eighty paces of her dressing room, and that any time she travels, her nanny must fly with her first class.
-- I have a feeling you're going to tell me.
-- overseeing the most cherished movie project of my career, am walking around with a pocketful of cherry Mike & Ike's?
-- Viktor, that was Short Subject.
Not just any Mike & Ike's -- cherry Mike & Ike's.  Do you know why I, Viktor Taransky, two-time Academy Award nominated director --
Hmm... Mike and Ike's.
-- Do you know what these are, Elaine?
Difficult.  I'm difficult.
God, Viktor.  Why do you always have to make things so difficult for yourself?
Excuse us.
No!  You will not give in to that blackmailing bitch!
We don't need a name.  We'll cast an unknown.
Of course she is.  No other name is going to sign on now and risk offending her.
Right beside you.  I borrowed Viktor's car.
Where are you?
Well, here I am.  You look pretty today.  Red suits you.
Yes -- oh my, God.  Is that you, Simone?!  I've been wanting to talk to you.
Hello, is this Elaine?
Hello?
Listen to what you're saying, mom. Is there any evidence she is?
Lainey, there's no evidence that Simone isn't real.
-- We don't believe daddy because we don't want to believe we were taken in too.
Well, I --

I know it's embarrassing to admit it, mom, but when I think about it -- honestly, I haven't.  I mean, it feels like I have.  I know more about her than members of my own family.  She's even in my dreams. But I realized, going back through my diary, they were all TV appearances, near misses at parties, second-hand rumor, gossip on the internet.  I've never actually seen Simone up close, touched her, been in her physical presence.  Have you?
I mean really meet her -- in the flesh.
Of course.  What are you suggesting?
So you did meet her?
I know it as surely as you're sitting here, sweetheart.  She was the most vital woman I ever met.
Because obviously she existed, right?
God, it's so like your father.  Why can't people take responsibility for their actions anymore?  I can almost forgive him for killing Simone -- but denying her existence.  I can never forgive that.
Just a minute.
Let's go, Lainey.  There's nothing here.
It was a great show, Dad...
Thank Simone for the tickets.
Sometimes.  But, just when I think your father's changing for the better, I realize he's as self absorbed as ever.  He took the credit for Simone tonight.
Mom, do you miss Dad?
I have to talk to her.
Elaine, do you realize you can't stop talking about Viktor?
Obviously, this can't last.  She's going to dump him.  Viktor won't be able to take that.  He's too sensitive.  It'll destroy him.
Why?
I can't believe she's doing this -- taking advantage of him this way. It's cruel.
He also happens to be the most talented man I've ever known.
You had no choice, Elaine.  He's a liability.
Please put your clothes on
Why are we here?  Is that what you're asking, Jack?... Why are we here?  No why.  Just here.
Is that a problem?
You're with me to be close to her?
Yes, yes, again, again.  Do what you do to Simone.  I want to know what it's like to be her just for one night.
Simone?
Yes, call me Simone.
What I do to Simone?
Do what you do to Simone.
What?... What did you say?
I do find myself physically attracted to you, Mr. Taransky.
Yes, of course, but very beautiful in your own right.
... so much like her?
You look so, so...
Of course.
You understand you'll have to come back to my place to keep them off the, er...  ... scent.
No, thank God for you, Mr. Taransky.  How many men would go to so much trouble to protect a woman?
Thank God for you, Faith.  I know this is above and beyond the call of duty for a stand-in.  You don't know what a service you're performing for Simone -- shielding her from those animals.
And what may I ask brought this on?
That's true.  I can reveal that I am considering a career in politics.
We all do.  But now I understand you're eager to get back to work -- and not the kind of work that we're all expecting.
With everything that was going on in my life, I just needed to drop out of sight for a while -- I needed time.  Viktor bought me that time.  I owe him so much.
Frank, you know as well as I do, living in a fish bowl, the insatiable appetite of the media...
-- Simone, the question on everyone's mind is simply... "why?"
I suppose the thing I like most about the movies I'm in is that they're not about special effects.
What exactly was it that attracted you to your first two projects?
Nudity has just never been an issue for me, Frank.  For me, clothes are just an option.
How about the nudity?
Sure.  Where would you like to start?
Let's talk about the work that you care so much about.
No, I'm okay.
That's a good question.  As Nietzsche said, "Whenever a man strives long and hard to appear someone else..."
Who are you really?
Because, you have to understand, Frank, these interviews -- none of this is real.  Who I am on screen and who I really am are two totally different people.
I'm not even sure I deserve it. After tonight I'll have almost as much screen time on your show as I do in my movies.  How is that healthy for a performer?
You don't secretly want the attention?
Don't I know it.  That's the only reason I'm here now -- to put the attention back where it belongs, on Mr. Taransky's film.
Of course, the only problem with shying away from publicity these days is that it tends to attract more.
I just think actors talk too much. Does the world really want to hear your life story just because you've got a movie opening Friday?
Well, no one could accuse you of being over-exposed, Simone.  Why have you stayed so completely out of the limelight?
Simone!
No.  In fact, between us, she doesn't really exist.
I have to talk to her about my experimental film.  It's very... experimental.
I know what you mean.
You know I sometimes forget she has bodily functions.
Somebody said she was here.
I'm fine, Hal.  How are you?
Is she here?
I can't explain it to you now -- you'll see when it's all put together.  Anyway, we got it a couple of takes ago.  Let's move on.
How did the wall get there?
-- No.  No.  A real wall.  You ran right through it.
-- an emotional wall, I know. That's why --
There's... a wall between you --
Why not?
You can't.
